result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew P. Cyra was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
*If probation revoked, huber priveleges for work and counseling
*1/2 to be served on electronic home monitor, if approved
*If successfully completes probation and agent deems appropriate, Court will allow expungement

miscConds.notes: *Pay restitution to Save-A-Lot joint/several with co-defendant, Elliot Shannon

*Pay costs
*Pay DNA Surcharge 
*If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.

*Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:  Save-A-Lot in Stevens Point 
*Provide DNA Sample 
*Participate in any counseling or assessments as recommended by the agent.

timeConds.notes: *To be completed, preferably, with the Portage County Parks Department

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Matthew P. Cyra in court with attorney Christopher G. Klingman. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard today are 15CM329 & 16CM215.

9:32  a.m.  Atty Constable calls the case and states the appearances.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
15CM329:
Count 1 - Previously entered - DPA revoked

16CM215:
Count 1 - DRI
Count 2 - DRI

BY THE COURT:
Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Constable makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Klingman makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant makes a statement prior to sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
15CM329:
Count 1 -
DPA revoked
Impose/Stay 180 day jail sentence
If probation revoked, huber priveleges for work and counseling
1/2 to be served on electronic home monitor if approved 
Placed on Probation for 12 months:
**Conditions of Probation - 
Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:  Save-A-Lot in Stevens Point
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
Provide a DNA sample 
Pay restitution in the amount of $86.41 joint/several with co-defendant Elliot Shannon on 16CM215.
Participate in any counseling or assessments as recommended by the agent.
Perform 40 hrs of community service perferrably with Portage County Parks Department
If successfully completes probation and agent deems appropriate Court will allow expungement.

16CM215:
Count 1 - DRI
Count 2 - DRI
Plea hearing on August 18, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on June 20, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Matthew P. Cyra in court with attorney Christopher G. Klingman. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Both files heard: 15CM329

3:04 p.m.  Court calls the case. 
Atty Cousins makes statements to the Court.  Files restitution summary with the Court.
Atty Klingman makes additional statements to the Court.  

BY THE COURT:  Court grants the motion to vacate the DPA and will set the matter for a pre-trial conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 20, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Notice of Motion and Motion to Vacate Deferred Prosecution Agreement filed by the State

Defendant Matthew P. Cyra in court with attorney D. Nicholas Carroll. ADA Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin. ADA Constable informs the court of a DPA agreement for 12 months w/conditions stated on the record. If successful, the State would then file a Dismissal.  Parties agree with joint recommendation. Court reviews DPA agreement.  BTC:  Court approves and signs DPA.
State informs the Court that victims notification was complied with.
